They asked me about myself, why I wanted the job, and why I thought I would be good for the agency. They also asked me some difficult scenarios and how I would handle them.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weaknesses?

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Big Brothers Big Sisters
Interview Descriptions: I had three interviews, met with several different people in the company. Also had an extensive 2 hour long phone interview. The Human Resources process was very slow, and the company never took the time, after all of mine was invested, to reach out to me personally about not getting the job.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Match Support Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Big Brothers Big Sisters (Boston, MA) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very straightforward. I gave them a call in which they gave me an email to send in a cover letter and resume. That was followed up by a phone interview, then followed up with an in person interview.
Interview Questions: Tell me an example of when you went above and beyond to help a customer.

title: Public Relations Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Big Brothers Big Sisters (Gainesville, FL) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: Very simple. My interviewer was a recent college graduate who had gotten a job there the previous semester. The questions were more personal as the program is working with children and seemingly wanted to get as sense of my background. My interviewer asked questions to get to know me and how I had worked with kids in the past, my work ethic, previous jobs and my experience level in public relations.
Interview Questions: What kind of fruit would you be and why?

title: Match Support Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Big Brothers Big Sisters (Lancaster, CA) in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: Briefly asked about former experience working with people and past experience in the social work field. Was asked how I was at handling conflict between people and high stress jobs.
Interview Questions: Are you comfortable making phone calls?

title: Enrollment Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Big Brothers Big Sisters in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: I forwarded my resume via email and received an email the next day requesting a phone interview. After the phone interview then your resume is forwarded to the hiring manager. The hiring manager will schedule you for a second interview plus schedule you for a computer skills test along with a typing test.
Interview Questions: There were no difficult questions, just the basic questions.

title: Match Support Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Big Brothers Big Sisters (San Antonio, TX) in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: The supervisor  interviewed me was nice. I did not feel overwhelmed or intimidated as both the supervisor and the employee that was being relpaced asked me about my experience and gave me a few scenarios about certain volunteers on an average case load.
Interview Questions: they gave me scenarios and what would I do in those situations

title: Mentor M≪ Anager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Big Brothers Big Sisters
Interview Descriptions: Wasn't too bad, although initial interview took over 3 hours and interviewer did most of the talking.  Second interview was brief.  Decision was made in a decent period of time considering the norm.
Interview Questions: I don't remember - most questions were pretty typical - like strengths and weaknesses.

title: Enrollment and Match Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Big Brothers Big Sisters
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and was contacted in a few days to set up a phone interview. The phone interview lasted about 20 minutes and I was told more about the position and was asked to discuss experience, education, etc. From the phone interview, an in person interview was scheduled for the following week. I was interviewed by two individuals and the interview lasted about an hour.
Interview Questions: Think of a time when you adapted your communication style when dealing with someone who clearly had a different perspective than you. Tell me how you adapted the content of your message to ensure it was effectively received.

title: Match Support Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Big Brothers Big Sisters (Toronto, ON) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: Spoke with the Manager and Director for an hour and answered standard questions about working with children, having difficult conversations, and work-life balance. Completed a 30 minute case-management exercise after the interview.
Interview Questions: What are your self-care strategies?

title: Enrollment and Match Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Big Brothers Big Sisters
Interview Descriptions: Initial telephone interview that took about 10 minutes. I was told more about the Job Description :the  interview process for Bigs and family interviews for Littles, which might take 1 to 1 1/2 hour in the homes.  Was asked about my previous experience in the field. Follow-up question was: would I be comfortable doing this?  (My Answer :"Yes".)I was told there are forms, documentations to fill out afterwards.  What were my computer skills like? (Average 30-35 wpm. I could brush up on Excel if needed.) Interview ended on "someone will be getting back to you in a week or sooner."  I was emailed in 5 days that they were looking for someone with "more clinical experience in the field."
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Enrollment and Match Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Big Brothers Big Sisters (Wichita, KS) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed a a specialist in Wichita, KS. Received a call after submitting my resume online. Scheduled and interview and started working 2-3 weeks later. The process was straight forward. After the one on one interview with the hiring manager you're asked to write a report from a scenario given. Make sure to be detailed and proofread.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you had to deal with a difficult client?

title: Match Support Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Big Brothers Big Sisters
Interview Descriptions: I was invited to attend a group interview. There were 7 other candidates there. It was more like an information session.  We broke up into groups to answer  a case scenario question and then had to report to the larger group.  I was invited to attend a one on one interview, with two employees of the company.
Interview Questions: The most difficult question was specific to a phone transcript that I was given and had to answer questions about it.

title: Enrollment and Match Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Big Brothers Big Sisters (Boston, MA) in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview process overall went well. You are first phone screened and then brought in for a series of interviews. Due to the high volume of turn over, they are used to the interview process and happy to move it along quickly. The decisions can come very quickly, but they do require phone reference checks that can take some time to schedule.
Interview Questions: They ask about past experience in related fields, your passion for the work and availability to work overtime among others.

title: Relationship Development Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Big Brothers Big Sisters (Miami, FL)
Interview Descriptions: Went through a phone interview, a second interview and then a third interview with the Vice President and really felt as though I got the job but did not receive an offer.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when your dignity was challenged.

title: Intake Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Big Brothers Big Sisters
Interview Descriptions: Received a phone call to come in for an interview. I was interviewed by the CEO and Supervisor who were gentle in their approach to help with interviewee feel relaxed. Were respectful and very communicative. The interview lasted about 45 minutes and they told me when I can expect to hear from them should I be the chosen candidate.
Interview Questions: List all resources are you familiar with in this city. There are so many in a large city so I listed the ones I knew that were related to families or children.

title: Human Resource Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Big Brothers Big Sisters (Irving, TX)
Interview Descriptions: Went through a phone pre-screening process before the actual face-to-face interview.  Interviewed with the VP of HR and she was very straight forward and to the point but also comfortable. Good interview even though I was not chosen for the position.
Interview Questions: What was the most difficult employee relations situation I had been involved in?

title: Match Support Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Big Brothers Big Sisters
Interview Descriptions: The hiring and interview process was pretty straightforward and went smoothly. I first had a phone interview, and then was asked to come in for an in-person interview. The in-person interview was with three people-a member of upper management, a team lead, and a staff member.
Interview Questions: The questions were straight-forward and easy to answer if you have ever worked with children or have done any type of social service work.

title: Case Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Big Brothers Big Sisters (Decatur, IL) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: Multi-stage in-depth interview process. First was interviewed via phone, then in person by three people, and then a one-on-one with my future supervisor. I felt the process went smoothly and I felt well-informed each step of the way.
Interview Questions: How have you resolved conflict with a co-worker in the past?

title: Donation Driver Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Big Brothers Big Sisters (Las Vegas, NV) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: First interview is conducted by Operations manager. He is rude and acts like he doesn't want you to be there. Simple questions about your experience and then he'll have the lead driver conduct second interview, those guys are generally pretty nice.
Interview Questions: Really nothing out of the ordinary here. Schedule conflicts, experience, why BBBS, etc.

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Big Brothers Big Sisters (San Diego, CA) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: it was really brief, had to see which one would be fit for the kids. they called you if they liked your resume, then you went to the district office and sat down for an interview. asked questions about your goals, what would you do in this or that situation, and see if you were fit. easy interview tbh
Interview Questions: "What are your experiences working with kids?"

title: School Program Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Big Brothers Big Sisters (Baltimore, MD) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: I was first given a phone interview that was very brief and just asked a few basic questions (How much did I know about the organization? Why do I want to work for them? Etc). Then I was called in for an in-person interview with two directors/managers. They were both very pleasant and asked typical interview questions as well as give hypothetical scenarios to gauge how I would handle problems.
Interview Questions: Can you tell me what you think Big Brothers Big Sisters does?

title: Development Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Big Brothers Big Sisters (New York, NY) in Dec 2012
Interview Descriptions: I was brought in three different times and made to wait a lot.  There were lots of people who interviewed me.  Between interview sessions I was told to wait in the lobby and it seemed like I was not priority and people forgot about me.
Interview Questions: How do you prospect

title: School and Site Based Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Big Brothers Big Sisters (Lakewood, NJ) in Oct 2012
Interview Descriptions:
I applied online on Craigslist. I received a phone call about a week or two later where I scheduled an in-person interview at the office. I met with the CEO and Program Director. They informed me heavily about my position and what I would be doing. They asked about my experience working with children and why I was looking for a new job because I was still employed at the time. The interview was casual and I can tell they they felt positive about me at the interview. They informed me of the salary/benefits during the interview as well.

About a week later, I received a call where I received the job offer and worked there for about two and a half years!
Interview Questions: How familiar are you with computers?

title: Enrollment and Match Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Big Brothers Big Sisters
Interview Descriptions: Applied through craiglists. It was over a month before called in for an interview. They said I was interviewing with 1 person and I showed up to a group of 5 people. Interview questions were very long with multiple parts so you pretty much had to ask them to repeat all questions. I didn't have to answer the scenario questions because I gave examples during the regular interview portion. I was offered the job the following week.
Interview Questions: Describe a situation in which a supervisor did something you didn't agree with and how did you handle it.

title: School Based Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Big Brothers Big Sisters (Philadelphia, PA) in Sept 2012
Interview Descriptions: I had a phone interview and then went to the office for a job interview.  My first warning was that the saddest looking person in a very full elevator  went into the BBBS office.  I have worked at a BBBS agency before, so my guess was she was a mentoring manager.   I was interviewed by a panel of three.  Two of them were nice, but the head honcho ( as they had no ED at the time)  made me feel that I was at an interrogation instead of an interview.  She made way too many assumptions about me. all wrong.  I knew even if offered, there was no way I was working for this angry woman.  The two other women seemed a bit intimidated by the grump as well.
Interview Questions: The problem was that since there were 3 people and no one seemed to have a question written the interview was pretty random,not fun for the the interviewee. one question would be about my qualifications, and then a question about where my parents lived....and even where my boyfriends parents lived.  whaaa??    There were way too many personal questions asked...  questions about my family,my relationship.  It was probably the worst interview ever  which is kind of ridiculous since I had done the job before at another agency and actually supervised and trained other people for the same job.

title: Partnership Builder/Event Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Big Brothers Big Sisters in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: One quick interview. I went in and did the interview with my direct supervisor and the CEO. I was introduced to the staff on a quick tour. No phone interview and no second interview.  I was offered the position within a week.
Interview Questions: What fundrasining experience do you have and what would you change about it?

title: Event Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Big Brothers Big Sisters (West Palm Beach, FL) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: University commenced the Interview process in where basic Interview questions were addressed.  The next step included an interview with the employer which assured that this would be a best fit for the organization.  I enjoyed the process all together.
Interview Questions: Address an event where faced with a difficult team player, and what three solutions can be implemented to solve the issue?

title: Intern - Hourly Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Big Brothers Big Sisters (Chicago, IL) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: Very easy and the woman made me feel very comfortable. The woman made sure to look me in the eye while I was talking and made me feel like I was the only one in the room
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself?

title: Office Administration Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Big Brothers Big Sisters (Saint Louis, MO) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: Not very long, but several phone calls for screening then one interview face-to-face.  They took a bit to get back to me.  Pleasant interviewers, not super formal.  In person interview lasted about 45 minutes.
Interview Questions: What do you have to offer the company?

title: Case Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Big Brothers Big Sisters in Aug 2011
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very comfortable but they only asked me 1 question. I was interviewed by 2 people who were very nice and easy to talk with. But other than the one question, the time was spent just talking about the position. It was nice to learn all about the position, but it would be nice to have more questions asked about my interest and qualifications.
Interview Questions: What experience did I have with Big Brother Big Sister?

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Big Brothers Big Sisters (New York, NY) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: Interview with Human Resources, direct leadership, and the E.D.D. before getting an offer. Interview is a great way to learn what expectations are from the position and to meet your leadership.
Interview Questions: Interview questions were standard however, there is an emphasis on making sure that you understand the mission of the organization and that you've had some experience in the past.  Overall, each person wants to make sure you are a good fit for the organization.

title: Clay Count Area Director Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Big Brothers Big Sisters (Jacksonville, FL) in Jun 2010
Interview Descriptions: Walked into the office and gave the secretary my resume and asked if I could speak to someone about a position. She told me to come back in an hour and she would have me interviewed. I was interviewed with the COO and then the next day the CEO. It was mainly just talking to one another and not very formal. There is a lot of attrition in the position/company.
Interview Questions: Don't recall any specific questions.

title: Recruitment Interview
Application Type: The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Big Brothers Big Sisters (Saint Louis, MO) in Oct 2009
Interview Descriptions: Interview lasted around 45 minutes with most of the questions being your guideline human resource questions. It was a salary position starting at around 31000 in the 45-50 hours a week range. The interview was a one on one interview in a comfortable setting.  It took around 4 days to get the results back on the status of the job.
Interview Questions: Name a time in your past experiences in which you had to give a presentation to a large group of individuals?

title: Senior Software Applications Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Big Brothers Big Sisters (Philadelphia, PA) in Jun 2009
Interview Descriptions: I submitted an online application for the position.  Later, I was called for a brief telephone screen, then scheduled in-person interviews on-site with multiple people.  The questions were much more about attitude than skills, although there was one skill-specific interviewer.  The people were clearly passionate about the company and its mission.
Interview Questions: You're currently making above the salary range for this position - I want to make sure that won't be a problem before we continue.  Do you have any issues with taking a pay cut to work here?

title: Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Big Brothers Big Sisters in Jan 2009
Interview Descriptions: The interview went very well.  It was very relaxed and I did not feel at all like I was being interrogated.  The office was laid out in a comfortable way and the questions asked were all pertinent.
Interview Questions: What are your greatest strengths and weaknesses?

title: Education Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Big Brothers Big Sisters (Hartford, CT) in Aug 2008
Interview Descriptions: The communication was positive and very frank.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to make a change?

title: Big Sister Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Big Brothers Big Sisters in Jun 2008
Interview Descriptions: This interview was fairly easy, and completely worth it. It only lasted about an hour. I was asked questions about my background, my religion, my life in gneral. They then asked what age group you would like to work with and if you'd like a boy or a girl. They strive to meet the needs of both parties. Completely worth it.
Interview Questions: What is your religion?
